title: 2tonnes WORLD : Ateliers en ligne en Fran√ßais (dates multiples)
description:
[Atelier 2tonnes WORLD en fran√ßais]
Vous avez toujours r√™v√© de prendre du recul et d'imaginer un sc√©nario mondial pour un sc√©nario de transition bas carbone ? Et si vous pouviez agir, non seulement individuellement, mais au niveau mondial, en impliquant tous les pays et les grandes entreprises ? Parviendrez-vous √† atteindre les objectifs de l'Accord de Paris pour le climat ?
L'atelier 2tonnes a √©t√© cr√©√© en 2019 afin d'apporter une r√©ponse p√©dagogique et inspirante √† ces questions, avec 2 objectifs principaux :
Donner des outils scientifiques pour agir : comprendre les concepts cl√©s concernant le changement climatique et l'empreinte carbone, √™tre capable de comprendre son impact, et comprendre les ordres de grandeur entre les diff√©rents leviers d'action.
Aider les personnes √† comprendre le r√¥le qu'elles peuvent jouer dans le d√©fi climatique : prendre conscience de leur pouvoir d'agir, en tant que particulier et professionnel, voir les opportunit√©s de la transition √©cologique.
L'atelier est fait pour vous si vous souhaitez comprendre de mani√®re concr√®te et ludique ce qu'il faut pour que nos soci√©t√©s deviennent neutres en carbone en 2050. Avec d'autres participants, vous formerez une √©quipe dont la mission est de construire un sc√©nario de transition pour limiter le r√©chauffement climatique √† +1,5¬∞C. Pour ce faire, vous choisirez √† la fois les actions individuelles ET collectives √† mener dans les 30 prochaines ann√©es et verrez gr√¢ce √† notre simulation en direct apr√®s chaque tour de d√©cisions quels sont les impacts de vos choix et comment votre sc√©nario de transition progresse vers l'objectif 2050.
A la fin de l'atelier, vous aurez un aper√ßu de ce que signifie une transition vers la neutralit√© carbone en termes d'actions √† prioriser √† diff√©rentes √©chelles, quels acteurs et secteurs seront impact√©s.
2tonnes a connu une √©volution exponentielle. Au total, plus de 40 000 personnes ont particip√© √† l'atelier, qui compte aujourd'hui plus de 3 000 animateurs, en France et dans plus de 45 pays dont la Suisse, la Belgique, les Pays-Bas, l'Allemagne, l'Italie, l'Espagne‚Ä¶ √Ä l'automne 2022, 2tonnes a √©t√© choisi dans le cadre d'une formation √† la transition √©cologique qui r√©unira au total 25 000 hauts fonctionnaires fran√ßais, cabinets minist√©riels et ministres eux-m√™mes et touchera ensuite tous les agents de l‚ÄôEtat fran√ßais.

[ Sp√©cificit√©s de la version WORLD de 2tonnes ]
L 'atelier 2tonnes est d√©clin√© dans une version World, permettant √† la fois de jouer avec les donn√©es de son pays de r√©sidence, mais aussi d'incarner des d√©cideurs internationaux. Avec des donn√©es sp√©cifiques de 31 pays, cet atelier donne une vision globale et compl√®te des enjeux de la transition bas carbone et des d√©fis des diff√©rents pays.

Informations pratiques :
-Inscription au tarif libre. Toutes les devises sont accept√©es via l'outil de paiement Paypal
- Merci de vous connecter 10 minutes avant le d√©but de l'√©v√©nement
- Vous recevrez avant l'atelier un email avec un lien pour calculer votre propre empreinte carbone et jouer avec vos propres donn√©es ainsi que le lien de visioconf√©rence (pensez √† regarder dans vos spams)
Assurez-vous de prendre 10 √† 20 minutes la veille de l'atelier pour compl√©ter votre empreinte carbone personnelle. L'exp√©rience est bien plus fun et puissante si vous jouez avec vos donn√©es r√©elles !
Si vous n'avez pas re√ßu d'e-mail 48H avant l'√©v√©nement, veuillez v√©rifier vos spams et recherchez un e-mail avec "2 tonnes" dans l'objet. Si vous n'en trouvez pas, contactez-nous √† contact@2tonnes.org et nous vous mettrons en relation avec l'animateur de votre session.

Venez avec le sourire aux l√®vres et la motivation d'agir pour un monde neutre en carbone.

title: 2tonnes World Version Intercompany training - Online (in english)
description:
[Online : 2tonnes Training in English with the World version]
‚úÖ Ô∏è What is the prerequisite for taking this training course ?
-Have participated in a 2tonnes World workshop.
üìÅ What will you learn from this training ?
This training will allow you to :

-Learn how to use the web platform
-Experience a live demo

-Benefit from the expertise of the facilitator

After the training, you will have access to further resources on the web platform and to videos and readings to deepen your expertise.
You will be part of our community of volunteer facilitators. You will also have the opportunity to keep in touch with members of your group via a Slack channel.
Please note : Upon completion of the 2tonnes workshop, you will have the right to facilitate it for free. However you will not have commercial rights. To have the right to charge for the workshop you are required to complete a second training course.
üìù How is the training course organized ?
-How many people can train at the same time ? 12 people maximum
-How many people from the same company ? 3 people maximum. Beyond 3 people, two solutions : either you book an intra-company training session, i.e. a specific training for your company or you split the number of people and wait for the next session.
The price includes participation in the 4 hour training course, access to all the self-training tools, access to the web platform, the right to use the course on a voluntary basis or with colleagues, and the 2 follow-up sessions of 45 minutes to be planned with the entire class.
-And lastly, how much will it cost to facilitate with my colleagues ? 20‚Ç¨ HT/participant (a degressive rule applies above 500 participants)
Practical information
Make sure to connect 5 minutes before the start of the event.
If you have any question, please reach out to us at ophelie@2tonnes.org !

Description

4 ‚Ä¢ Outils mis √† votre disposition pour vous accompagner dans l‚Äôanimation de la Fresque : ordre de grandeur, pr√©cautions, id√©es de debrief...

title: BELGIQUE / BELGI√ã - ARLON
full_location: ULi√®ge - Arlon Campus Environnement, Avenue de Longwy 185, 6700 Arlon, Belgique
description:
De Biodiversiteit Fresk is een ludieke wetenschappelijke workshop die door middel van collectieve intelligentie het bewustzijn over biodiversiteit vergroot. Door de wetenschappelijke basis van de biodiversiteit te kennen, kan de situatie beter worden begrepen en kan de informatie makkelijker worden gedeeld. Het begrijpen van de problemen leidt tot actie en acceptatie van verandering.

Het spel is georganiseerd in 3 fasen:

LEER: Je verzamelt je rond een tafel met een team van 4 tot 7 personen. Samen ontdekken jullie de kaarten die betrekking hebben op de verschillende aspecten van de biodiversiteit en werk je samen om oorzaak-gevolg verbanden vast te stellen.
CRE√ãER: Je personaliseert het ‚Äòfresco‚Äô door illustraties en een titel toe te voegen.
VOEL & HANDEL: Je deelt met andere spelers je gevoelens, vragen en gedachten en samen bespreek je idee√´n voor oplossingen en acties.


Kom en ontdek samen gedurende 3 uurtjes waar het om gaat, wat echt belangrijk is en hoe je kan systeemdenken. Je hoeft echt geen voorkennis te hebben, enkel ge√Ønteresseerd zijn. Jouw financi√´le bijdrage gaat direct naar de Biodiversiteit Fresk organisatie om zich verder te kunnen ontwikkelen. Heb je geen creditcard? Je kunt ook kiezen voor een gratis deelname en eventueel een donatie meebrengen die ik vervolgens aan de organisatie doneer."

The Biodiversity Collage is a fun, cooperative workshop that aims to raise awareness about the importance of biodiversity and the causes and consequences of its erosion. During this workshop you will discover how ecosystems work, how humankind interacts with biodiversity and why biodiversity is crucial for human well-being. 
  We are an association that believes in the access to knowledge for all, which is why our public workshops are on a donation basis. All donations go towards enabling the association to grow further afield so that more and more people understand the issues around biodiversity-loss, and are empowered to create change.

title: ENGLAND - London Climate Centre Islington Biodiversity
full_location: London, Climate Centre Islington
description:
!The text gives you the UK time!

The Biodiversity Collage is a fun and collaborative workshop that aims to raise awareness about the importance of biodiversity.
With a set of cards based on the IPBES reports, you will:
Recreate ecosystems using 2 starters
Understand the 3 pillars of Biodiversity and the 5 main pressures
Turn your Collage into a piece of art
Reflect and develop an action plan to stop biodiversity loss
The workshop lasts 3h30.
The Biodiversity Collage association believes that everyone should have access to knowledge, which is why the fee to participate in this workshop is on voluntary basis, depending on what you can and want to give.
Donations can be made in cash at the end of the workshop: they will help spread this knowledge.
  More information: https://fresquedelabiodiversite.org/en.html

title: ONLINE Biodiversity Collage workshop (EN) - with Benoit Sarrade
description:
Workshop held in English

The Biodiversity Collage is a playful and cooperative workshop that aims to raise awareness around the stakes of biodiversity collapsing. During this workshop, you will discover the functioning of ecosystems, the part that Biodiversity plays for the Humanity well being, the interactions with human activities and the threat regarding its erosion.
This workshop will be held online using a videoconference tool (zoom) and a collaborative tool (MURAL). The participation to this workshop requires then a computer with a functioning microphone.
The connection info will be sent by email before the workshop.
  The participation to the workshop is under open pricing, starting from 10‚Ç¨. The collected amount will be used to finance the tools of the association "Fresque de la Biodiversit√©", actions to raise awareness as well as the development of the Fresque de la Biodiversit√© network.
  Length : 3h00
15 min Presentation of the workshop + Icebreaker + getting familiar with the tool Mural
30 min Starter to understand the mecanism of the ecosystems
75 min Biodiversity Collage, with 5 decks and 40 cards.
30 min Creativity, to pimp your collage absorb the information
30 min Restitution, debriefing and discussion

The Biodiversity Collage is a fun and collaborative workshop that aims to raise awareness about the importance of biodiversity. During this workshop, you will discover how ecosystems function, how it plays a crucial role for humankind and its wellbeing, and the pressures it faces.
The Biodiversity Collage association believes that everyone should have access to knowledge, which is why the fee to participate in this workshop is on voluntary basis, depending on what you can and want to give. All donations go towards the association and help spread the Biodiversity Collage workshop.

  The Digital Collage is a playful and collaborative workshop. The aim of the workshop is to raise awareness and train participants on the environmental issues of digital technologies.

  The price of your participation is free with a minimum amount of 5‚Ç¨, it will finance the association "La Fresque du Num√©rique" (The Digital Collage).

title: ONLINE DIGITAL COLLAGE TRAINING IN ENGLISH - INT DC Facilitation Training 18:30 GMT G. Due
description:
Please note that this facilitation training is intended for people :
- who have attended a Digital Collage workshop in the last 6 months
- who have already attended a Climate Fresk workshop (please contact us if you are unable to meet this requirement)

Your ticket is not modifiable and it is refundable only up to 7 days before the training. Would you please ensure you'll be really be able to attend this event, in order to maximize the group collective intelligence. Thanks in advance.

This citizen training is run on a voluntary basis. The price of your participation is free with a minimum of ‚Ç¨25 and this is intended for the association "La Fresque du Num√©rique".

This training will allow you then to facilitate Digital Collage workshops in any non-commercial context under the Creative Commons BY-NC-ND license. In order to facilitate within a professional context, this will be soon available ; additional prerequisites will be required as well as the signature of a contract with the organisation. We will come back to this at the end of the training. 

This session will take place online using a video conferencing tool and a visual collaboration tool. All technical information will be sent by email to registered participants a few days before the workshop. Out of respect for other participants, nobody will be accepted if more than 10 minutes late.
Once registered, your name, first name and email will be sent to the facilitator in charge of this session, in order to send you a briefing email before the session and another email after. This data will not then be kept by the association.

title: ASIA PACIFIC DIGITAL COLLAGE TRAININGS IN ENGLISH - Facilitation Training - Online APAC
full_location: Online
description:
Please note that this facilitation training is intended for people :
- who have attended a Digital Collage workshop in the last 6 months
- who have already attended a Climate Fresk workshop (please contact us if you are unable to meet this requirement)

Your ticket is not modifiable and it is refundable only up to 7 days before the training. Would you please ensure you'll be really be able to attend this event, in order to maximize the group collective intelligence. Thanks in advance.

This citizen training is run on a voluntary basis. The price of your participation is free with a minimum of ‚Ç¨25 and this is intended for the association "La Fresque du Num√©rique".

This training will allow you then to facilitate Digital Collage workshops in any non-commercial context under the Creative Commons BY-NC-ND license. In order to facilitate within a professional context, this will be soon available ; additional prerequisites will be required as well as the signature of a contract with the organisation. We will come back to this at the end of the training. 

This session will take place in person at the address indicated. Detailed information will be sent by email to registered participants a few days before the session. Out of respect for other participants, nobody will be accepted if more than 10 minutes late.
Once registered, your name, first name and email will be sent to the facilitator in charge of this session, in order to send you a briefing email before the session and another email after. This data will not then be kept by the association.

description:

  The Digital Collage is a playful and collaborative workshop. The aim of the workshop is to raise awareness and train participants on the environmental issues of digital technologies.

R√©flexion (1h15) : √©tude des causes et cons√©quences de nos consommations sur le climat, la biodiversit√©, la sant√© et la r√©silience alimentaire

description:

  Que signifie concr√®tement respecter l‚Äôaccord de Paris ? Nous avons pris l‚Äôengagement de  maintenir le r√©chauffement en dessous de +2¬∞C pour r√©ussir √† garder une plan√®te habitable. description:

  Que signifie concr√®tement respecter l‚Äôaccord de Paris ? Nous avons pris l‚Äôengagement de  maintenir le r√©chauffement en dessous de +2¬∞C pour r√©ussir √† garder une plan√®te habitable. title: Water Puzzle Workshop online - 07/03/2023
description:
Fresque de l'eau
The Water Puzzle Workshop, online
Discover the issues related to water, its availability, its uses, and its sensitivity to climate change.
This workshop builds a global vision of the water cycle, thanks to a card game set up by the players according to 4 different sets:
- the natural water cycle,
- the anthropogenic water cycle (influenced by humans),
- the impacts of humans
- the impact of climate change on these cycles.
At the end, a discussion about individual and collective measures that can be taken is launched with the players. 
About the session
The link will be sent two days before the event, by mail. Check your spams ! The event is for individuals, maximum two persons by company. The session will occur with at least 4 players. Cancellations are refundable if they occur at least 48 hours before.
Tarifs : Classic price is 10 euros. You can support the association with a higher amount.

title: Diversity Fresco
description:
The Diversity Fresco "the online edition" is a 3h30 hours workshop to raise awareness about how discrimination work, and setting a frame to dialogue and understand. 
The workshop is based on the principle of collective intelligence and allows to experiment the cognitive mecanismes at work behind discriminations. By discovering the possible approaches to reduce them and discuss their impacts and limits, you will aquire a common vocabulary that will make it easy to have open and contructive dialogues on the matter. 
The maximum number of participants for the online edition is 10. 
The workshop will be facilitated by St√©phanie de Susanne and Florence Szymanski, senior facilitators. 
  What set up to expect :
- we will use Zoom to talk to eachother, in plenary and in small groups;
- we will use Mural, a digital platform, to manipulate the material.
Please note that in order to be able to participate you must use a computer and ***NOT*** a tablet or you phone. It doesn't work for the kind of workshop you'll experiment. Using a mouse and a set of headphones will also make it more confortable. 
----- 
Do you have any need you'd like us to know as to allow you to fully participate to the workshop ? Contact us to make the necessary arrangements. 
-Ôªø----
The diversity Fresco is a workshop co-designed by Belugames & l'Essec Business School.
https://fresquedeladiversite.org/

title: Textiles UnTangled : textiles impacts and solutions game workshop
description:
4 PM - 7 PM Paris Time 
Event Time Announcer - Textiles Untangled online workshop (timeanddate.com)
  Facilitator : Lavanya JAYAKAR
  Textiles are everywhere! In our clothing, furniture, toys and even computers! But how much do you really know about them? What exactly are our textiles made from? How sustainable are they, really? How far do our clothes travel before we buy them? Where do they go once they are donated?
  This collaborative workshop illustrates the complexities and impacts (social and ecological) of the textile industry by using clothing as a case study. You will create the production chain of textiles, learn about the industry‚Äôs impact, and then work together to find solutions and actions you can take.
  This workshop is inspired by the pedagogy of the Climate Fresk (an interactive workshop that teaches the IPCC Climate report). Experience this unique way of learning, if you are new to the Fresk universe of workshops. Launched in 2021, Textiles UnTangled has been enjoyed by over 600 participants.
  You will learn:
  1. Materials 101 - What fabrics should I choose!?!
2. The life cycle of textiles, from raw materials to end of life
3. Textile industry impacts on the planet and on humans.
4. How to think critically of claims made by companies & organizations about their sustainability
5. Notions of circular economy, systems view thinking, and human centered solutions
6. Actions that can be taken on a collective, business, and individual level
All while working together and having fun!
  Our main sources: Ellen MacArthur Foundation, Preferred Textiles Report, OXFAM, Fashion Revolution and ADEME.
  What participants have said:
  "This game is a fun, civic-minded and inclusive way to think about our relationship to clothing. I highly recommend it!" - Anonymous
  "I learned valuable information about the choices one can make to minimize one's impact of GHGs and other pollutants when consuming textiles, whether it be clothing, furniture or other textile products." - Alex
  A nice workshop to better understand the impacts of the textile industry with lots of mini games. Fun and interesting, for everyone, I love it! - Sylvaine
  Thank you to them and all our participants! We have a 4.4 / 5 satisfaction rate!
  Who is this for?
  All expertise levels welcome! From people who wear clothing (haha) to textile producers! Textiles are everywhere and concern everyone. Experts in the field also enjoy this workshop and its ability to give a holistic view of the industry, spark discussion, and capacity-build in their organizations. Some companies who have played: Vestiaire Collective, Deloitte, Givenchy, Promod, Caroll and Minelli, Balzac, and Electrolux. For a private session you can contact: greendonut.info@gmail.com
  Who is this by?
  Textiles UnTangled game workshop (Textile Collage) was created by the volunteers at Green Donut. Created in France in 2019, Green Donut is an association whose mission is to promote the donut economics model by Kate Raworth (a society prospering within environmental and social limits) via their serious games and actions in the community. They are professionals, experts and concerned citizens of many backgrounds. While based in France, they have diverse backgrounds and welcome members from other countries.
  Their website (in french only for now) with all their events including our Fresque de D√©chets (Waste Collage = French only): http://greendonut.org
  Commitment and Cancellation
  This workshop is a small group workshop (max 8 participants) that needs a minimum to fully capitalise on our collective intelligence. If you must cancel, please do so a week before. Request a refund via Billetweb and it will be granted, minus the Evenbrite fees. If cancelled within a week, please let us know. You are welcome to transfer the ticket to someone else. You can notify us at greendonut.info@gmail.com. Thanks in advance.
    Now let‚Äôs learn about textiles to change the world together!

title: Fresque des D√©chets en ligne
description:
Session anim√©e par : Cyril RETOURNE
  La Fresque des D√©chets est un atelier ludique et collaboratif invitant les participants √† sch√©matiser le devenir de leurs d√©chets, √† prendre conscience des impacts de leurs habitudes de consommation et √† r√©fl√©chir ensemble aux actions √† mener pour les r√©duire.
  O√π vont nos d√©chets une fois collect√©s ? Comment sont-ils trait√©s ? Quelles sont les cons√©quences environnementales de l‚Äôincin√©ration, de l‚Äôenfouissement et du recyclage des d√©chets ? Qu‚Äôest-ce que le lixiviat ? Voici des questions auxquelles vous serez en mesure de r√©pondre apr√®s l‚Äôatelier.
  La Fresque permet aussi de prendre conscience de notre consommation de ressources au quotidien √† travers le prisme des d√©chets tout en sensibilisant sur les bonnes pratiques de tri et de pr√©vention.
  Elle permet enfin de r√©fl√©chir sur les pratiques de r√©duction des d√©chets et de d√©couvrir des alternatives z√©ro d√©chet, z√©ro gaspillage.
  Une partie du jeu consiste √† prendre connaissance des cartes collectivement, puis √† les disposer par liens pour cr√©er une fresque. Une seconde partie de d√©brief et d‚Äô√©changes suivra.
